txt.en: Another Siege on Trestlebridge
Completed

You hear the clanking of hammers not far from here. Whenever the Orcs deign to build, the construction has only one use: war.

You should find and disable the siege-engines, and stop their construction once and for all.

<rgb=#FF0000>Fellowship recommended.</rgb>
Find and destroy siege-engines
Find and destroy siege-engines
Destroyed siege-engines ([placeholder]/[placeholder])
You have defeated the Defiler responsible for brewing the sleeping draught that led to the catastrophe at Trestlebridge.
Defeated a half-orc engineer ([placeholder]/[placeholder])
Somewhere within Nan Wathren lies an enemy potion-brewer, deadly in his craft.
You have destroyed the remaining plans for a fresh attack on Trestlebridge

Siege-engines can be found in central Nan Wathren.

You should find and destroy the siege-engines of the enemy.

<rgb=#FF0000>Fellowship recommended.</rgb>
Completed

Siege-engines can be found in central Nan Wathren.

You should find and destroy the siege-engines of the enemy.

<rgb=#FF0000>Fellowship recommended.</rgb>
Find and destroy siege-engines

Siege-engineers can be found somewhere in central Nan Wathren.\n\nThe Tarkrîp Orcs do not seem cunning enough to have constructed the siege-engines. Surely there are engineers serving the enemy, and these intelligent foes should be defeated.
Find and destroy siege-engines ([placeholder]/[placeholder])

The siege-plans can be found in central Nan Wathren, near where the engineers once stood.\n\nThe half-orc engineers left a collection of plans behind for the siege on Trestlebridge. You should destroy the plans, which will likely save many innocent lives.
Defeat a Tarkrîp Siege-engineer ([placeholder]/[placeholder])
Destroy the siege plans left behind
Find and defeat the Tarkrîp Defiler
You have done much to ensure the safety of Trestlebridge this day. The Tarkrîp siege-machines have been dismantled, and the plans of attack have been allayed.
Find and defeat the Tarkrîp Defiler
The Tarkrîp of Nan Wathren have taken to building siege-engines for another attack on Trestlebridge.
You have done much to ensure the safety of Trestlebridge this day. The Tarkrîp siege-machines have been dismantled, and the plans of attack have been allayed.
You have defeated the Tarkrîp Defiler
